algorithm_technique: Monotonic stack applied to a doubled array to handle circularity
problem_summary_simple: Find the next greater element for each number in a circular array.
problem_summary_technical: Employs a monotonic decreasing stack on a doubled version of the circular array to find the next greater element for each original element.
key_insights: To handle circularity, the array can be conceptually doubled (or iterated twice).
A monotonic decreasing stack helps find the next greater element efficiently.
When iterating from right to left, elements popped from the stack are smaller than the current element and are candidates for the next greater element.
